channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What Americans think of Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and his health stances
Judge: Pardoning Oath Keepers leader Stewart Rhodes for Capitol riot plot would be ‘frightening’
item.description: The federal judge who presided over the seditious conspiracy case against Oath Keepers members says it would be “frightening” if the anti-government g...

item.title: Supreme Court agrees to review TikTok ban-or-sale law
item.description: The high court said Wednesday it will review a challenge submitted by TikTok asking for the overturn of a law that could ban the video-sharing app by ...

item.title: The bald eagle isn't actually America's national bird — but that's poised to change
item.description: After learning the U.S. doesn't officially recognize the bald eagle as its national bird, a Minnesota man swooped in. This week the House passed his b...

item.title: CDC confirms first severe bird flu case in the U.S.
item.description: A person in Louisiana has the first severe illness caused by bird flu in the U.S., the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention announced Wednesday.

item.title: Suspect in UnitedHealthcare’s CEO killing charged with murder as an act of terrorism
Supreme Court takes up South Carolina's effort to defund Planned Parenthood
item.description: The state cut off funding to Planned Parenthood because it provided non-abortion services to Medicaid patients.

item.title: Mexico asks US to hand over 'mastermind' in journalist's killing
item.description: Mexican officials say cartel boss Damaso Lopez Serrano ordered the killing of well-known journalist Javier Valdez in 2017.

item.title: Viewers watched 20.35 billion hours on Twitch in 2024. 'Stream Big' explores why
item.description: According to the Twitch 2024 community recap, viewers watched 20.35 billion hours on the live-streaming service. A forthcoming book explains why.

item.title: Thirteen dead after naval speedboat hits ferry off Mumbai
item.description: Three navy personnel are among the dead, while more than 100 people have been rescued, an official said.

item.title: Russia moving equipment at Syrian bases, satellite images show
item.description: Images show a build up of military vehicles at Russia's two bases in Syria near the Mediterranean Sea.

item.title: Senate passes $895 billion defense bill with gender-affirming care restriction
item.description: The Senate approved the mammoth National Defense Authorization Act despite concern from some Democrats over a controversial gender-affirming care poli...

item.title: Tens of thousands without water in Mayotte as curfew brought in
item.description: Rescuers race to find missing people and survivors in the French territory devastated by Cyclone Chido.

item.title: Trump wants Herschel Walker to be U.S. ambassador to the Bahamas
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump plans to nominate former football star and 2022 Georgia Senate candidate Herschel Walker as the U.S. ambassador to the Ba...

item.title: Are gold ETFs a good investment now that the price is dropping?
item.description: The price of gold has fallen recently, so does a gold ETF investment make sense right now?

item.title: Charlotte Hornets apologize after a gift-giving skit went awry
item.description: The Charlotte Hornets' mascot appeared to award a fan a video game console, but the device was taken away when the cameras stopped.

item.title: France's ex-President Sarkozy loses corruption case appeal
item.description: Nicolas Sarkozy - who now must wear an electronic tag - says he will challenge the ruling in Europe's court.

item.title: Genital herpes is a 'forgotten' virus. But that doesn't mean it's gone away.
item.description: Over 800 million people have genital herpes — and in many cases the virus can flare up over a person's lifetime, causing painful symptoms. So why does...
